Major_Arcs.title: The Enigma of Ghost Town and Airport Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a time-displaced woman in Ghost Town and the ensuing conflict arising from modern plans to build an airport, threatening the town's historical significance and her connection to it.

sub_scenes.title: Arrival and Frustrated Explanations
sub_scenes.description: The woman's bewildering arrival in Ghost Town and her desperate attempts to explain her situation to the town's inhabitants, highlighting her urgency and their lack of understanding.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Explanations in Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Airport Plans and Preservation Clash
sub_scenes.description: The woman overhears plans to build an airport in Ghost Town, sparking her horror and confrontation with the men involved, highlighting the conflict between modern progress and historical preservation.

narrative_arcs.title: Discovery of Airport Plans and Confrontation in Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Tensions and Cal's 'Real' Offer
sub_scenes.description: A shift to the woman's relationship with Cal, exploring romantic misunderstandings, past hurts, and Cal's redirection of their conversation towards a significant proposition in the 'blasted desert'.

narrative_arcs.title: The Real Offer in the Blasted Desert
Arrival at the Work Site and Confrontation with Workers

Major_Arcs.title: Horses, Airport Business, and Nan's Distress
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the practicalities of horse transportation related to the airport construction, intertwined with Nan's personal and familial conflicts, including romantic tensions with Cal and disagreements with her father.

sub_scenes.title: Horse Transportation and Airport Logistics
sub_scenes.description: Discussions revolve around a plan to transport horses by air from the new airport, and the financial aspects of renting horses to construction workers.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Frustration and Father-Daughter Conflict
sub_scenes.description: Nan's dissatisfaction with the airport project and her arguments with her father about business priorities, escalating into personal reprimands and emotional distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Helping Construction Workers and Crazy Notions
Solace in Tears and Maid's Comfort

Major_Arcs.title: Navigating Love and Business in a Western Setting
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores Nan's romantic relationship with Cal, set against the backdrop of the airport and cattle business. It delves into advice from family and maids, confrontations, and eventual emotional resolutions amidst practical concerns.

sub_scenes.title: Seeking and Receiving Romantic Advice
sub_scenes.description: Nan receives differing advice from her mother and the maid regarding love, patience, and understanding Cal's actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Mother's Advice on Love and Patience
Maid's Practical Advice and Cal's Love

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation, Chase, and Business Urgency
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts Cal seeking clarity, leading to a chase and a shift back to the pressing matter of the horse business and airport deadlines.

narrative_arcs.title: Desperate Chase and Plea for Attention
Yore Dad's Deal and No Backing Down

sub_scenes.title: Emotional Confession and Departure leading to Reunion
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her feelings, followed by Cal's departure and Nan's reflective loneliness, culminating in Cal's return and confession of his own feelings.

Major_Arcs.title: Winter's Fury and Community Relief
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the onset of a severe winter snowstorm, its devastating impact on cattle, and the eventual relief provided by an 'Operation Hay Lift' from the newly planned airport, bringing hope amidst hardship.

sub_scenes.title: Affection, Foreboding, and Weather Crisis
sub_scenes.description: Intimate moments between Nan and Cal are juxtaposed with a grim weather report, foreshadowing a severe snowstorm and its potential impact.

sub_scenes.title: Despair, Hope, and Community Aid
sub_scenes.description: Initial despair and resignation to the relentless snowfall turn to hope with the unexpected arrival of a plane carrying fodder, representing community aid during the crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Sound of Hope: Arrival of the Plane

Major_Arcs.title: Cowtown Showdown and Shifting Perspectives
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and his forceful character in a Western town, showcasing public reactions and differing opinions on his actions, particularly from Jeff, Sally, and an older man.

sub_scenes.title: Public Spectacle and Initial Judgments
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson's violent display in the street and the varied reactions from townspeople, setting the stage for differing interpretations of his character.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Critical Opinion of Chane Benson
Sally and Older Man's More Mature Perspective on Chane Benson

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Gun Handling and Escalating Conflict
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Jeff's fascination with guns and his idolization of his brother Clyde, leading to arguments with Sally and a dangerous escalation involving threats and violence.

sub_scenes.title: Hero Worship and Gun Handling Concerns
sub_scenes.description: Sally reflects on Jeff's unhealthy hero worship of his brother and confronts him about handling a gun, expressing her growing concerns.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Past Hero Worship and Questioning Gun Handling

sub_scenes.title: Reassurance and Benson's Storytelling
sub_scenes.description: Sally seeks reassurance from Clyde about Jeff, while a new character, Mr. Benson, appears and begins to tell a suspenseful story, possibly related to Chane Benson.

narrative_arcs.title: Reassurance and Commitment to Change Jeff
Introduction of Mr. Benson and Storytelling

Major_Arcs.title: Article Accusations and Benson's Deceptive Reassurance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc revolves around Sally's confrontation with Clyde about an article, her fear of Benson, and Benson's deceptive attempts to reassure them while secretly plotting against Clyde.

sub_scenes.title: Article Denial and Benson Threat Warning
sub_scenes.description: Sally confronts Clyde about a supposed article, while also expressing her fear of Benson and warning Clyde about the danger he poses.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Denial about the Article
Benson's Declaration to Stay and Fight Killers

Major_Arcs.title: Escalating Threats and Dinner Deception
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the escalating conflict between Benson and Clyde, characterized by threats, defiance, and a deceptive dinner invitation orchestrated by Jeff's sister with ulterior motives.

sub_scenes.title: Open Threats and Clyde's Defiance
sub_scenes.description: Surrett is directly threatened by Benson's men, but Clyde remains defiant and continues to publish articles against Benson, leading to public reaction and shifting opinions.

narrative_arcs.title: Clyde's Defiant Articles and Public Reaction

sub_scenes.title: Dinner's End and Benson's True Intentions Revealed
sub_scenes.description: The aftermath of the dinner, including Benson's flirtatious behavior, Jeff's jealous reaction, and Benson's internal thoughts revealing his sinister plans.

narrative_arcs.title: End of Dinner and Moonlight Charm

Major_Arcs.title: Violent Confrontation and Town Showdown
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the escalation of conflict into physical violence, culminating in a tense standoff between Jeff and Benson to protect Clyde.

sub_scenes.title: Physical Assault and Chase
sub_scenes.description: Benson attacks Jeff, followed by Jeff's determined chase to rescue Clyde from Benson's threat.

sub_scenes.title: Standoff Resolution and Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: The tense standoff between Jeff and Benson resolves with Benson's departure, leading to reflection, remorse, and a return to newspaper work.

narrative_arcs.title: Resolution of the Standoff and Benson's Departure
Reflecting on Tension and Expressing Remorse
Headline Change, Relief, and Newspaper Work

Major_Arcs.title: Range War and Betsy's Bodyguard
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new conflict centered around a range war, introducing Betsy and Steve Daley, her hired bodyguard, amidst escalating tensions and threats.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Confrontation and Bodyguard Introduction
sub_scenes.description: An initial tense confrontation is followed by the introduction of Steve Daley as Betsy's bodyguard, setting up the context of danger and protection.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley as Bodyguard
Discussion of Range War and Underlying Troubles

Major_Arcs.title: Store Visit and Escalating Range War Violence
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Betsy's visit to town with Steve, where they encounter antagonists, leading to physical altercations and observations about Steve's dangerous skills.

sub_scenes.title: Store Departure and Daley Observation
sub_scenes.description: Departure from the store area and Steve's deliberate observation of Daley, setting a tone of suspicion and vigilance.

narrative_arcs.title: Departure from the Store and Daley's Observation
Confrontation with Fred Bridges and Hired Hand
Observations on Steve's Skills and Impending Danger

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy's Conditions and Love Confessions
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Betsy's decision regarding Steve's employment, her developing romantic feelings for him, and the ultimate choice between love and his gunfighting profession.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Job Condition and Maverick's Gratitude
sub_scenes.description: Betsy sets conditions for Steve's employment, followed by Maverick's observation and gratitude for Betsy's actions.

narrative_arcs.title: Maverick's Observation and Question to Betsy
Hank Defends Steve and Maverick's Suggestion

sub_scenes.title: Love Confession and the Choice
sub_scenes.description: Betsy sets a condition against gunfighting for Steve's job, leading to a sudden confession of love and a difficult choice between love and Steve's identity.

narrative_arcs.title: Steve's Dilemma and Betsy's Confession of Love
Steve's Ultimate Proof of Love and Betsy's Acceptance

Major_Arcs.title: Range War Escalation and Betsy's Defiance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the escalating range war conflict, featuring confrontations, threats, and Betsy's defiant stance against Old Man Bridges and Hank, culminating in her readiness for violence.

sub_scenes.title: Bridges' Anger and Accusations
sub_scenes.description: Old Man Bridges expresses his anger and accusations towards Betsy and Hank, escalating the range war conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Bridges Confronts Hank and Accuses Trespassing
Betsy and Steve Prepare for Confrontation
Betsy Justifies Gun Violence as Necessary
Betsy Recounts the Ambush and Loss of Horses
Aftermath of the Ambush and Hank's Escape

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy's Violent Resolve and Steve's Ultimatum
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Betsy's decision to resort to violence to resolve the range war conflict, leading to a confrontation and ultimatum from Steve regarding her violent path.

sub_scenes.title: Decision for Violence and Relationship Ultimatum
sub_scenes.description: Betsy resolves to use guns to settle the conflict, leading to an argument with Steve and his ultimatum, forcing a critical decision in their relationship.

narrative_arcs.title: Ride to Devil's Pass and Gunfire Encounter

Major_Arcs.title: Gunfight at Devil's Pass and Romantic Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the violent confrontation at Devil's Pass, Betsy's injury, and the subsequent emotional reunion and reaffirmation of love between Betsy and Steve amidst the chaos.

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Injury
sub_scenes.description: Arrival at Devil's Pass, Steve's warning, and the ensuing gunfight where Betsy is injured.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Warning

Major_Arcs.title: Rancher's Daughter and Dave's Departure
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces a new storyline focusing on a Rancher's Daughter and a man named Dave, exploring their personal conflict and Dave's decision to leave.

sub_scenes.title: Disagreement and Departure Decision
sub_scenes.description: A woman confronts Dave, expressing disapproval of his decision to leave and her own refusal to go with him.

sub_scenes.title: Ranch Concerns and Bear Fenin's Threat
sub_scenes.description: The scene shifts to the ranch and introduces a new threat - Bear Fenin's encroachment, causing concern and unrest among the ranch hands.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern over Curley and Bear Fenin's Threat

Major_Arcs.title: Fence Conflict and Escalating Tension
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the escalating conflict over a newly built fence that cuts off water access, leading to a direct confrontation with Fred Gordon and rising tensions.

sub_scenes.title: Fence Confrontation and Cattle Worries
sub_scenes.description: Rancher's anger over the fence, confrontation with Fred Gordon, and concerns about the cattle's water access.

Major_Arcs.title: Past Guilt, Sarcasm, and Unexpected Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc explores past apologies, lingering resentment, and a sarcastic exchange that surprisingly leads to romantic developments and a marriage proposal.

sub_scenes.title: Reflection, Resentment, and Reluctance
sub_scenes.description: Reflection on past apologies and lingering resentment towards Fred Gordon, followed by Carrie's reluctance to discuss him.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Past Apologies and Lingering Resentment
Carrie's Reluctance to Discuss Fred and Preference for Dave

sub_scenes.title: Sarcastic Truce and Romantic Proposal
sub_scenes.description: Sarcastic confrontation turns into a tentative truce and an unexpected movie invitation, culminating in a romantic marriage proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Confrontation and Demand to Leave Dave Alone
Reflection on Love and a Marriage Proposal

Major_Arcs.title: Deception, Confrontation, and Business Deal
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc reveals Fred's deceptive motives behind the proposal, leading to Carrie's confrontation and a tense business meeting where truths are uncovered and decisions are made.

sub_scenes.title: Realization of Deception and Accusation
sub_scenes.description: Carrie realizes Fred's proposal was a trick, leading to a confrontation and accusations of deception.

narrative_arcs.title: Realization of Deception and Contract Motive
Night of Reflection and Business Meeting

sub_scenes.title: Carlton's Office Confrontation and Surrender
sub_scenes.description: Confrontation in Carlton's office, Carrie's assertive stance, and a surprising declaration of surrender, setting up the aftermath of the business deal.

Major_Arcs.title: Emotional Farewell and Confession of Love for Fred
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Carrie's farewell to Fred, her confession of love for him to Dave, and the revelation of her true feelings, contrasting with past pride and resistance.

sub_scenes.title: Angry Farewell and Town Encounter
sub_scenes.description: Carrie's angry farewell to Fred and a chance encounter with Dave in town, hinting at underlying emotional tensions.

Major_Arcs.title: Illness, Truth Revelation, and Romantic Reunion
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts Carrie's illness, the revelation of Fred's honorable actions regarding the beef contract, and the subsequent emotional reunion and romantic resolution between Carrie and Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Illness and Carlton's Urgent Message
sub_scenes.description: Carrie's illness and the arrival of Mr. Carlton with urgent news, setting the stage for a crucial revelation.

narrative_arcs.title: Carrie's Shame, Regret, and Joyful Ride

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk's Injury and Chris's Duty vs. Love
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts to a new storyline with Chris and Dirk, depicting Dirk's injury, the arrival of the Marshal, and Chris's internal conflict between her love for Rance and her duty.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Injury and Doctor's Visit
sub_scenes.description: Dirk seeks Chris's help while injured, followed by a flashback and a doctor's examination revealing a bullet wound.

narrative_arcs.title: Past Encounter - Dirk and Chris Meet

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Marshal's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: Concern for Dirk leads to investigation and the arrival of Marshal Rance Cready, initiating a legal conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern for Dirk and Investigation Plan
Sheriff Arrives and Identifies Chris & Dirk's Trail
Plea for Delay and Conditional Stay

Major_Arcs.title: Pursuit, Shooting, and Mexican Escape
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the pursuit of Dirk and Chris, culminating in a violent confrontation where Chris is accidentally shot, followed by Dirk's escape to Mexico and Chris's decision to return to Rance.

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit and Violent Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Discovery of pursuit, flashback to evasion attempts, and a violent confrontation where Chris is accidentally shot.

sub_scenes.title: Escape to Mexico and Chris's Return
sub_scenes.description: Escape to Mexico, Dirk's farewell, and Chris's decision to return to Rance, despite Dirk's escape and Rance's injury.

narrative_arcs.title: Fleeing the Scene and Bandaging Wounds
Escape to Mexico and Criminal Escape
Return to Rance and Confession of Love
Concern for Rance and Separate Paths
Arrival in Mexico and Uncertain Reunion

Major_Arcs.title: Rance's Recovery and Wedding Day
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Rance's recovery, his reunion with Chris, and their wedding day, culminating in Dirk's unexpected but ultimately peaceful return.

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Recovery and Love Confession
sub_scenes.description: Rance's unconsciousness and recovery, followed by Chris's confession of love and Rance's marriage proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Inquiry About Business and Father's Opinion

sub_scenes.title: Wedding Day and Dirk's Arrival as 'Best Man'
sub_scenes.description: Wedding preparations, Chris and Rance's vows, and Dirk's unexpected but peaceful arrival at the wedding, becoming a 'best man' figure.

narrative_arcs.title: Vows and Fears Before the Wedding
Backstory of the Man and Rance's Support
